class ContentLoss[source]

ContentLoss(target) :: Module

Calculate mse loss between two feature maps from the same layer

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

gram_matrix[source]

gram_matrix(input)

A gram matrix will calculate the relation between the filter activated caused by an image. Multiple filters being activated together by in image can be thought of as it's stlye

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class StyleLoss[source]

StyleLoss(target_feature) :: Module

Calculate mse loss of the gram matrix of the two feature maps from the same layer

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Normalization[source]

Normalization(mean, std) :: Module

The VGG19 network was pre-trained with normalized images, so we will apply the same normalization to images fed into this application

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_style_model_and_losses[source]

get_style_model_and_losses(cnn, style_img, content_img, content_layers=['conv4_2'], style_layers=['conv1_1', 'conv2_1', 'conv3_1', 'conv4_1', 'conv5_1'])

We're going to build a model where we insert our content/style layers into the pre-trained cnn These layers are "transparent", as they pass along the input unaltered, but have their own custom loss functions that our optimizer will use on the generated image.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
